record.dc:title: Centrifugally decoupling touchdown bearings
record.dc:creator: Post, Richard F
record.dc:description: Centrifugally decoupling mechanical bearing systems provide thin tensioned metallic ribbons contained in a support structure. This assembly rotates around a stationary shaft being centered at low speeds by the action of the metal ribbons. Tension springs are connected on one end to the ribbons and on the other end to the support structure. The ribbons pass through slots in the inner ring of the support structure. The spring preloading thus insures contact (or near-contact) between the ribbons and the shaft at rotation speeds below the transition speed. Above this speed, however, the centrifugal force on the ribbons produces a tensile force on them that exceeds the spring tensile force so that the ribbons curve outward, effectively decoupling them from mechanical contact with the shaft. They still remain, however, in position to act as a touchdown bearing in case of abnormally high transverse accelerations.
record.dcq:publisherResearch: LLNL (Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL), Livermore, CA (United States))
record.dc:identifier: OSTI ID: 1135721, Legacy ID: OSTI ID: 1135721
record.dc:rights: Patent Assignee: Lawrence Livermore National Security, LLC (Livermore, CA)

record.dc:title: Ultra-thin ohmic contacts for p-type nitride light emitting devices
record.dc:creator: Raffetto, Mark; Bharathan, Jayesh; Haberern, Kevin; Bergmann, Michael; Emerson, David; Ibbetson, James; Li, Ting
record.dc:description: A flip-chip semiconductor based Light Emitting Device (LED) can include an n-type semiconductor substrate and an n-type GaN epi-layer on the substrate. A p-type GaN epi-layer can be on the n-type GaN epi-layer and a metal ohmic contact p-electrode can be on the p-type GaN epi-layer, where the metal ohmic contact p-electrode can have an average thickness less than about 25 .ANG.. A reflector can be on the metal ohmic contact p-electrode and a metal stack can be on the reflector. An n-electrode can be on the substrate opposite the n-type GaN epi-layer and a bonding pad can be on the n-electrode.
record.dcq:publisherResearch: NETL (National Energy Technology Laboratory, Pittsburgh, PA, and Morgantown, WV (United States))
record.dc:identifier: OSTI ID: 1135722, Legacy ID: OSTI ID: 1135722

record.dc:title: Combined raman and IR fiber-based sensor for gas detection
record.dc:creator: Carter, Jerry C; Chan, James W; Trebes, James E; Angel, Stanley M; Mizaikoff, Boris
record.dc:description: A double-pass fiber-optic based spectroscopic gas sensor delivers Raman excitation light and infrared light to a hollow structure, such as a hollow fiber waveguide, that contains a gas sample of interest. A retro-reflector is placed at the end of this hollow structure to send the light back through the waveguide where the light is detected at the same end as the light source. This double pass retro reflector design increases the interaction path length of the light and the gas sample, and also reduces the form factor of the hollow structure.
record.dcq:publisherResearch: LLNL (Lawrence Livermore National Laboratory (LLNL), Livermore, CA (United States))
record.dc:identifier: OSTI ID: 1135723, Legacy ID: OSTI ID: 1135723
